business.headline: Sensex ends 143 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; Pharma stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 142.87 points to 82,000.71 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 33.20 points to settle at 25,083.75.

Ministers' panel approves scrapping of 12%, 28% GST slabs; 90% goods may get cheaperIn a key meeting held on Thursday, the panel of state ministers accepted the Centre's plan to reduce the four-rate system to two main slabs of 5% and 18%.

How can retirees stay safe from risky 'too good to be true' schemes?Many retirees fall prey to schemes that seem too good to be true, chasing high returns without understanding the risks. Protecting your savings requires caution, awareness, and smart investment choices.

Why zero GST on insurance premiums doesn't mean cheaper policies for youOn the surface, removing GST on insurance premiums seems like a big relief, but experts caution that the outcome may not be what many are expecting.

EPFO withdrawal, pension or transfer: How to choose the right PF formEPFO members often get confused about which form to fill for withdrawals, transfers, or pension claims. Using the right form not only saves time but also avoids delays or rejection of your application.

CA explains why 80% of emergency funds don't work when neededMost people believe they are financially prepared for tough times, but when a real crisis hits, their so-called emergency funds often fall short. A chartered accountant explains why this happens and how to fix it.

Online Gaming Bill 2025: What are the different penalties in it?The Bill, which was passed in the Lok Sabha soon after it was introduced, focusses on reducing risks linked to addiction, money laundering, and misleading advertising.

No GST on life, health insurance premiums soon? Here's what it means for youA proposal has been made to exempt premiums for life and health insurance from Goods and Services Tax (GST), a move that could bring down costs and boost insurance penetration.
Sensex opens 150 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; RIL gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 122.01 points to 81,979.85, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 20.45 points to 25,071.00 as of 9:23 am.

4 IPOs to close for bidding today: Which one will give you best listing gains?All four IPOs opened for subscription on August 19 and will complete allotment on August 22. The listing of these companies is scheduled for August 26 on the BSE and NSE.

Now you can buy land via a mobile app in minutes. Here's howThe initiative is intended to make land purchases easier, quicker and more transparent by using a platform that millions already rely on for daily shopping.

Will next-gen GST make homes more affordable?With the government considering a simpler two-slab GST structure, many are asking a key question: Will the new system finally make home buying more affordable?

entertainment.headline: Kriti Sanon shares BTS prep from Cocktail 2, says one step at a timeDirector Homi Adajania teased fans with a "work in progress" glimpse of Kriti Sanon from his upcoming sequel Cocktail 2. The BTS (behind-the-scenes) post, later re-shared by Kriti, sparked excitement as she called it "one step at a time."

Exclusive: How Aryan Khan prepared for his speech at The Bads of Bollywood launchAryan Khan's debut speech at 'The Bads of Bollywood' preview wasn't just effortless charm - it was hours of preparation, fatherly guidance, and a moment of pride that lit up social media.

Maa OTT release: When and where to watch Kajol's mythological horror dramaKajol's mythological horror film 'Maa' to soon premiere on Netflix. Backed by Jyoti Deshpande and Ajay Devgn, among others, the film was directed by Vishal Furia.

Nandamuri Balakrishna is a grounded man, says Akhanda 2 co-star Aadhi PinisettyActor Aadhi Pinisetty takes on a villainous role in 'Akhanda 2', marking a bold shift in his career. He highlights the freedom in playing darker characters and praises his collaborators Nandamuri Balakrishna and Boyapati Srinu.

Indra review: Vasanth Ravi's thriller is too basic to be the thriller it promisedRelease Date:Fri Aug 22, 2025Indra movie review: Directed by Sabarish Nanda, 'Indra' is a crime thriller starring Vasanth Ravi, Mehreen Pirzada, and Sumesh Moor. The film is too basic to make a significant impact, which a crime thriller demands.

Exclusive: Vivek Agnihotri calls himself voice of Hindus, a cinematic psychiatristIn an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, Vivek Agnihotri spoke about 'The Bengal Files', describing himself as the "voice of Hindus" and the "psychiatrist of Indian society." The director of 'The Kashmir Files' and 'The Vaccine War' said his new film highlights Bengal's "untold history."

Farah Khan gushes over shirtless Tom Cruise in BTS clip: Eternally grateful!Tom Cruise's behind-the-scenes video from 'Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning' went viral, not just for his daring stunts but also for a shirtless moment that caught everyone's eye. Filmmaker Farah Khan joined the fun with a cheeky comment, thanking the Hollywood actor for removing his shirt.

Your time has come: SRK's friend Mushtaq Sheikh's emotional letter for AryanShah Rukh Khan's friend, Mustaq Sheikh, dedicated a letter to Aryan Khan amid his directorial debut 'The Bads of Bollywood' launch on August 20. The show will premiere on Netflix on September 18.

Yuzvendra Chahal shares cryptic post after ex-wife Dhanashree opens up on divorceCricketer Yuzvendra Chahal shared a cryptic Instagram post just hours after his ex-wife Dhanashree Verma opened up for the first time about their divorce and the trolling she faced.

Songs of Paradise: Saba Azad, Soni Razdan to lead film on Kashmiri music legendA new film, 'Songs of Paradise' starring Saba Azad and Soni Razdan, was announced on Thursday. Inspired by the life of Kashmiri playback singer Raj Begum, the film will premiere on Prime Video on August 29.

Who are influencer duo Awez Darbar and Nagma Mirajkar, set to join Bigg Boss 19?Ahead of 'Bigg Boss 19' premiere, find out all about its rumoured contestants Awez Darbar and Nagma Mirajkar. While Awez is known for his dance videos, Nagma creates content on beauty and lifestyle.

The power of Aryan Khan's Papa Hain Na - SRK, father first, superstar nextAryan Khan's emotional words "Papa Hain Na" at the preview launch of 'The Bads of Bollywood' stand for Shah Rukh Khan's journey as a father. From protecting Aryan during his darkest days to launching Suhana Khan in 'King', SRK's greatest role is being the father who's always there.

Naga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala visit Tirupati temple. WatchNaga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala visited the Tirumala Tirupati temple on Thursday. Their videos from their temple visit are now doing the rounds on social media.

Producer Naga Vamsi to get Rs 22 crore from YRF after War 2 Telugu losses: ReportYash Raj Films reportedly stepped in to compensate producer Naga Vamsi and partners after the Telugu version of 'War 2' underperformed at the box office. The film features Jr NTR and Hrithik Roshan in lead roles.

Gia Manek marries Varunn Jain in intimate ceremony, calls it a forever unionTelevision actor Gia Manek has married Varunn Jain in an intimate ceremony. The couple shared wedding photos and announced their union on social media.

Hansika Motwani has hilarious reaction to people commenting on her life. WatchHansika Motwani is currently holidaying in Bali with her friend. Amid her divorce rumours, she shared a hilarious video of her reaction to reading comments about her personal life.

Can Ayushmann-Rashmika's Thama redefine vampire tales for Indian audiences?'Thama' is Bollywood's fresh take on vampire lore, blending Indian folklore with gothic romance. Can the film's success reshape Indian horror by localising Western myths authentically? Here's a glimpse at whether Indian audiences may fall in love with vampires the way West has.

KBC 17: Crorepati Aditya Kumar bows out at Rs 7 crore question, settles for 1 croreOn Kaun Banega Crorepati 17, Uttarakhand contestant Aditya Kumar impressed viewers by winning Rs 1 crore after narrowly missing the Rs 7 crore jackpot.

Nick Jonas's bizarre bed habit leaves fans calling him crazyNick Jonas has revealed his strict rule of using the bed only for sleeping, avoiding activities like eating or watching TV, which has surprised many fans. This quirky habit has sparked lively discussions on social media.

general news.headline: Ministers' panel approves scrapping of 12%, 28% GST slabs; 90% goods may get cheaperIn a key meeting held on Thursday, the panel of state ministers accepted the Centre's plan to reduce the four-rate system to two main slabs of 5% and 18%.

Young Congress leaders talented, making Rahul Gandhi insecure: PM to NDA leadersSources added that no opposition leader attended the meeting, which was limited to the ruling alliance. PM Modi, they said, described the recently concluded Parliament session as a good one because important bills were passed.

Rahul Mamkootathil quits as Kerala Youth Congress chief amid harassment allegationsYouth Congress Kerala president Rahul Mamkootathil resigned following harassment allegations. Malayalam actor Rini Ann George claimed the party ignored complaints without naming him, while writer Honey Bhaskaran directly accused the MLA of misconduct.
India-Russia ties steadiest since World War II, says Jaishankar in MoscowWe see relation with India as special strategic partnership: Russian Foreign Minister as he meets Jaishankar

Not the BEST start: Thackeray brothers reunite after 20 years, score a big zeroAfter two decades of rivalry, Uddhav and Raj Thackeray reunited, but their much-hyped alliance crashed spectacularly in its very first test, failing to secure even a single seat in the BEST Credit Society elections. The defeat exposed not just the hollowness of their combined strength but also how far the Thackeray legacy has drifted from Bal Thackeray's once unshakable political command.

How Trump is unifying Brics brick by brickThe Brics alliance has long been seen as a loosely structured bloc beset by a lack of trust in their own ranks. But in the face of Trump's tariff bombs, all of that is passe. While India has ramped up ties with Russia and China, South Africa and Brazil are also following suit.
Isro to launch Gaganyaan test mission in December: Shux says India is readyIsro to launch maiden Gaganyaan test mission in December, Shubhanshu Shukla says India is ready

What happened has happened: Ahmedabad school stabber's chilling chatA Class 10 student of an Ahmedabad school was stabbed to death by his junior after an altercation, with a police probe uncovering a chilling chat.
The Defence Ministry's biggest test after Operation SindoorA flurry of defence procurement announcements, a tortoise-paced acquisition process, and a chance to fix the system.

Sikh boy tops Lahore Board with 98 in Islamiyat and Quran, 60 in scienceOnkar Singh, a 15-year-old Sikh student in Pakistan, excelled in Lahore's 9th class board examination. Onkar, the son of Minmal Singh, scored 98 in Islamiyat and 49/50 in the Translation of the Holy Quran in BISE. His achievement stands out in a year when the pass rate in Punjab is just 45%.

China's Xi makes rare visit to Tibet, says Tibetan Buddhism needs to changeChinese President Xi Jinping's rare visit to Tibet has underscored Beijing's push to tighten control over the region, marking the 60th anniversary of its designation as a Chinese autonomous region. Xi, while skirting any mention of the Dalai Lama, said there was a need to "guide Tibetan Buddhism to adapt to socialist society".

Tourism, troops, warming: The triple threat to Ladakh's glaciersThe Himalayan glaciers are going through a churn as global warming and climate change begin to hit this delicate world, responsible for maintaining the balance of the cryosphere.

Invited me to hotel: Malayalam actor accuses young Kerala politician of harassmentMalayalam actor Rini Ann George accused a young politician of sending offensive messages. The BJP demanded the resignation of Congress MLA Rahul Mamkootathil, even though the actor did not name anybody in particular.

Students thrashed by traders in Kolkata, called Bangladeshi for speaking BengaliFour Calcutta University students were attacked in Kolkata's Sealdah after a clash with traders who allegedly called them Bangladeshi for speaking Bengali. Police have arrested two accused traders in relation to the case.

Are engineers taking over India's civil services?Engineers increasingly dominate UPSC civil services recruitment, reducing humanities graduates' presence. This shift raises concerns about losing empathy and diverse perspectives in India's bureaucracy.

From protecting Aryan during his darkest days to launching Suhana Khan in 'King', SRK's greatest role is being the father who's always there.

Scrolling through Insta Reels has same effect on brain as alcoholSeveral studies suggest that short-form videos trigger reward pathways in ways similar to addictive substances like alcohol, while neurologists in India caution about long-term rewiring of motivation, focus, and even memory.

How Pakistan's Failed Marshal Munir succeeded in wooing TrumpAfter Pakistan's drubbing by India in Op Sindoor, a failed Asim Munir promoted himself to Field Marshal. But the failed marshal succeeded in wooing US President Trump with oil, cryptocurrencies, rare-earth riches, and a Nobel dream, all of which are non-existent. This is how Munir humoured Trump in uniform.

Powdered electrolyte drinks hydrate fast, but are they really safe?Powdered electrolyte drinks, often called 'IV in a bottle,' promise fast and easy hydration. They sound convenient and fancy, but the real question is, do they actually live up to the hype?

Indians learnt lesson, can't trust US: Economist Jeffrey Sachs on tariff falloutRenowned American economist Jeffrey Sachs said the steep tariffs imposed on India were self-defeating and risk damaging one of America's most important relationships in Asia.

No word from Jagdeep Dhankhar on government house, but bungalow ready: SourcesThe Urban Development Ministry has kept a Type-8 bungalow ready for Jagdeep Dhankhar, though the former Vice President has yet to seek official accommodation after resigning last month on health grounds.

sports.headline: Shreyas Iyer's father on Asia Cup snub: Not asking for captaincy, at least select himAsia Cup 2025: Shreyas Iyer's father, Santosh, has urged the selectors to give his son an opportunity in the T20I format. He revealed that Shreyas was gutted after missing out on a place in the Asia Cup squad.

Sanju Samson's Asia Cup spot under threat after Shubman Gill's inclusion: KaifMohammad Kaif has said it will be tough for Sanju Samson to secure a spot in India's playing XI for the Asia Cup. Kaif believes Shubman Gill, who is now the vice-captain, will open the innings alongside Abhishek Sharma.

What is Bronco test? BCCI's new fitness benchmark and how it differs from Yo-YoThe BCCI has reportedly introduced a rugby-centric Bronco fitness test for Indian players in an effort to ensure consistently high fitness standards. It will now be used alongside the established Yo-Yo test and 2-kilometer time trial to assess players' readiness for international competition.

No issue backing Gill, but what about Jaiswal? Ex- IND batter on Asia Cup squadFormer India batter S. Badrinath has questioned the decision to snub Yashasvi Jaiswal and Sai Sudharsan from the Asia Cup 2025 squad in favour of Shubman Gill. The 25-year-old comes into the team as the vice-captain of the team.

Paul vs Davis confirmed, Netflix superfight set despite 60-pound gapJake Paul vs. Gervonta Davis is set for Nov 14, 2025, in Atlanta, with the event all set to be streamed exclusively by NetFlix. With a 60+ pound weight gap, the fight will see Paul try to end his feud with Davis inside the ring.

Ajinkya Rahane steps down as Mumbai captain ahead of new domestic seasonVeteran India batter Ajinkya Rahane announced on Thursday that he would be stepping down as captain of Mumbai ahead of the upcoming domestic season. Rahane took to social media to reveal his decision, citing the need to groom a new leader within the team.

Mohammed Siraj's X-factor will be missed in Asia Cup 2025: Harbhajan SinghHarbhajan Singh feels that Mohammed Siraj should have been included in the Asia Cup squad. The former cricketer thinks that the pacer could have chipped in as the 'x-factor' for India during the upcoming tournament.

BCCI extends Ajit Agarkar's term as men's chief selector till June 2026: ReportBCCI has reportedly extended Ajit Agarkar's tenure as chairman of the senior men's selection committee till June 2026. This move comes after India's strong performances under his leadership, signalling stability amid upcoming cricketing challenges.

Sinquefield Cup: Gukesh held by Sevian, Praggnanandhaa draws with AbdusattorovWorld champion D Gukesh was held to a draw by the lone wild card, Samuel Sevian of the United States, while fellow Indian R Praggnanandhaa also split the points with Nodirbek Abdusattorov of Uzbekistan in the third round of the Sinquefield Cup.

Sara Errani's message after US Open Win: This one is for all doubles playersSara Errani dedicated her US Open mixed doubles win alongside Andrea Vavassori to the doubles specialists who missed out on playing in the tournament. Errani and Vavassori defeated Iga Swiatek and Casper Ruud in the final on Wednesday, August 20.

Can Sanju Samson do a KL Rahul to stay indispensable in T20Is?Asia Cup 2025: Shubman Gill's return to the T20I fold has complicated matters. Sanju Samson, who had forged a promising opening partnership with Abhishek Sharma, now finds his place under threat. Can the Kerala wicketkeeper-batter adapt, reinvent himself, and make his spot indispensable?

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
